intro: Cistanthe densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
